wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 5/08/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Hi, everyone. It’s mid-week and the news coming out from the white house shows that the Trump administration wants to allow debt collectors to be able to call those they’re collecting on 7 days a week. And how good are your products and services, could you sell them to your sister? This may say a lot about what you’re selling and how you’re selling it. Are you a perfectionist? Many are, but as much as this character trait can help us achieve higher levels of quality, it’s also important to keep this in check. And check out our choice podcast today, featuring Tim Farriss on “Ask Gary Vee.”

ECONOMY

Debt collectors would be allowed to call you 7 times a week under Trump administration proposal

Under the plan, consumers could opt out of receiving collection notices through text or email, and the CFPB said in a statement that debt collectors would be required to send disclosures with information for consumers on how to respond.

 

PERSONAL FINANCE

Selling insurance to your sister

If your product or service isn’t good enough to sell to strangers now, it’s not going to be good enough after you sell it to your inner circle.

 

BUSINESS

The misplaced coffee cup on ‘Game of Thrones’ has earned Starbucks ‘tens of millions’ in free publicity

On Monday, HBO confirmed to INSIDER that the rogue coffee spotted in a scene of the eighth season’s fourth episode, “The Last of the Starks,” was from the set’s craft services, which serves drinks and food to the cast and crew.

 

PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT

How to Manage Your Perfectionism

Perfectionism is a double-edged sword. On one hand, it can motivate you to perform at a high level and deliver top-quality work.

Tim Ferriss & I Discuss Entrepreneurship On #AskGaryVee 271

In this podcast, guest Tim Ferriss speaks about topics such as forcing yourself and others to make decisions, learning when to say yes vs. no and having a lot of depth in your content so that you can put out as much content as possible.
